result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Theft of Mail (10 to 29 pieces of mail)

9:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Emily Minerva Smith not in court, in custody at SCDC.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck appeared by phone for Emily Minerva Smith. 
Deft continues to refuse to come to the phone for her Court appearances. 
Court rcvd & reviewed competency report; Deft not competent to proceed but likely to regain. 
Attorney Limbeck not contesting findings of report.
Court finds deft not competent but likely to become competent, finds probable cause & suspends proceedings.
Deft committed to DHS. Court orders involuntary administration of medication and reviews days credit.
950/Marsy's Law complied with.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Limbeck is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 10/01/2022.  
Failure to make payment on the schedule as established above shall result in the remaining balance becoming immediately due. Sheboygan County through its Corporation Counsel, may initiate a lawsuit or other collection action against you to collect the amount due, together with costs.
The attorney shall be compensated at $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court. To receive payment, bill must be submitted within 90 days of withdrawal or case disposition.
Copy to DE at SCDC
Atty. Limbeck

1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Emily Minerva Smith not in court. 
Deft. refusing to come to phone and participate in hearing. 
Court received competency report, not competent but likely to regain. 
Court orders a Court Appointed Attorney for Deft, as Deft. is not cooperating with Public Defenders Office. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
950/Marsy's Law complied with.
Competency hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Competency hearing on August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
w/ attached cover sheet
for Competency Exam sent to the Court for signature

4:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Emily Minerva Smith not in court, in custody. Defendant refused to appear in person or by phone for this hearing. Defendant has been refusing to participate in court proceedings from the beginning. Refuses to speak w/Public Defender's office also.  Competency was raised in front of Court Commissioner. Court finds defendant waives right to participate, grounds to question competency and orders a competency examination. State is in compliance w/victim's rights.
Competency hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Competency hearing on August 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on July 21, 2022 at 04:30 pm.

*Refused to sign *
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements  - UA's & GPS

11:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Emily Minerva Smith not in court. Emily is refusing to attend court. Competency status will be scheduled. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set. 
Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
SPD
